study_overview:
Brief Summary

            This is a Phase 1/2, multicenter, randomized, placebo-controlled, double-blind study to evaluate the safety, tolerability, pharmacokinetics (PK), and pharmacodynamics (PD) of single and multiple doses of DNL593 in two parts followed by an optional open-label extension (OLE) period.

            Part A will evaluate the safety, tolerability, PK, and PD of single doses of DNL593 in healthy male and healthy female participants of nonchildbearing potential. Part B will evaluate the safety, tolerability, PK, and PD of multiple doses of DNL593 in participants with frontotemporal dementia (FTD) over 25 weeks. Part B will be followed by Part C, an optional 18-month OLE period available for all participants who complete Part B.
            Official Title
            A Phase 1/2, Multicenter, Randomized, Placebo-Controlled, Double Blind Single Dose and Multiple Dose Study to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics, and Pharmacodynamics of DNL593 in Healthy Participants and Participants With Frontotemporal Dementia Followed by an Open-Label Extension
            Conditions
            Frontotemporal Dementia
            Intervention / Treatment

                Drug: DNL593
                Drug: Placebo

            Sponsor: Denali Therapeutics

emails.subject: URGENT: SAE Report - Study DNLI-001 - Site 203 - Participant 203-005
emails.body:
Dear Team,

This is an urgent notification regarding a Serious Adverse Event for participant 203-005 in the DNLI-001 study (Part B).

The participant was hospitalized yesterday evening following a fall at home. They are currently stable and undergoing evaluation.

We are in the process of gathering all necessary source documentation and will forward the completed SAE form as soon as possible, well within the 24-hour reporting window.

Best regards,

Dr. Robert Miller
Principal Investigator
Oakwood Research Center, Site 203

emails.subject: Re: URGENT: SAE Report - Study DNLI-001 - Site 203 - Participant 203-005
emails.body:
Dear Dr. Miller,

Thank you for the prompt notification. We have received your alert and are on standby.

Please send the completed SAE form and any available source documentation (e.g., hospital admission notes, ER report) as soon as it is available.

We appreciate your diligence.

Best regards,

Maria Garcia
Clinical Research Associate
Synergy Clinical

emails.subject: Re: URGENT: SAE Report - Study DNLI-001 - Site 203 - Participant 203-005
emails.body:
Hi Maria,

Please find the completed SAE form and the initial hospital admission summary for participant 203-005 attached.

Dr. Miller has assessed the event as 'possibly related' to the investigational product due to the participant reporting a brief episode of dizziness prior to the fall. This is documented in the attached form.

We are awaiting further records from the hospital. Please review and let us know if any immediate additional information is required from our end.

Thank you,

Emily White
Study Coordinator
Oakwood Research Center

emails.subject: Fwd: URGENT: SAE Report - Study DNLI-001 - Site 203 - Participant 203-005 -- Sponsor Review Needed
emails.body:
Hi Alex,

Please see the forwarded email and attachments for the SAE reported at Site 203 (hospitalization due to a fall).

Key points:
- Participant in Part B
- PI causality assessment: 'possibly related'

Could you please review the attached documents and confirm the sponsor's initial assessment and any immediate follow-up questions for the site? The Medical Monitor is on copy.

Thanks,
Maria

Hi Maria,

Please find the completed SAE form and the initial hospital admission summary for participant 203-005 attached.

Dr. Miller has assessed the event as 'possibly related' to the investigational product due to the participant reporting a brief episode of dizziness prior to the fall. This is documented in the attached form.

We are awaiting further records from the hospital. Please review and let us know if any immediate additional information is required from our end.

Thank you,

Emily White
Study Coordinator
Oakwood Research Center

emails.subject: [DT-1234] Scheduling Request: Interim Monitoring Visit at Site 105
emails.body:
Hi Maria,

Hope you are having a good week.

I'm writing to schedule the next interim monitoring visit (IMV) for the DT-1234 study at Centennial Medical Center. I am proposing the weeks of June 24th or July 8th for a 2-day visit.

Please let me know what dates within that timeframe work best for you and the PI.

Best regards,

Alex Johnson
Clinical Research Associate
Denali Therapeutics

emails.subject: Re: [DT-1234] Scheduling Request: Interim Monitoring Visit at Site 105
emails.body:
Hi Alex,

Thanks for reaching out. The week of July 8th works better for us. How about Tuesday, July 9th and Wednesday, July 10th?

Could you please send over the monitoring plan for our review prior to the visit?

Thanks,

Maria Garcia
Study Coordinator
Centennial Medical Center

emails.subject: Re: [DT-1234] Scheduling Request: Interim Monitoring Visit at Site 105
emails.body:
Hi Maria,

That's great, July 9th and 10th are confirmed on my end.

I've attached the monitoring plan for your review. To help streamline the visit, could we arrange for remote access to your EMR system a few days prior? Please let me know the process for requesting temporary credentials.

I will send the official confirmation letter once we have the access details sorted.

Best,

Alex Johnson
Clinical Research Associate
Denali Therapeutics

emails.subject: Re: [DT-1234] Scheduling Request: Interim Monitoring Visit at Site 105
emails.body:
Hi Alex,

Thanks for the monitoring plan. I've forwarded it to Dr. Evans.

For EMR access, please fill out the attached Non-Employee Access Request form and return it to me. Our IT department typically takes 2-3 business days to process these requests.

Once you send it back, I'll submit it and we can consider the dates fully confirmed. Let me know if you have any questions.

Best,

Maria

emails.subject: URGENT Follow-up Required: Critical Overdue Queries for Site 301 - Study DNLI-STX-01
emails.body:
Hi Alex,

Hope you are well.

I am forwarding a list of critical, overdue data queries for Site 301 (PI: Dr. Wells) that require immediate attention. We are rapidly approaching the database lock deadline for the Q4 analysis, and resolution of these queries is on the critical path.

The attached spreadsheet details 8 critical queries related specifically to participant dosing records. These discrepancies must be clarified by the site to ensure data integrity.

Could you please follow up with the site coordinator, Jessica Miller, to ensure these are resolved in the EDC system within the next 48 hours? 

Please let me know if you anticipate any issues or need further clarification from the data management team.

Thanks for your urgent attention to this matter.

Best regards,

Sarah Chen
Lead Data Manager
Synergy Clinical

emails.subject: [URGENT] Protocol Deviation - Study DNLI-123 - Site 456 - Subject 101-003
emails.body:
Hi Ben,

I am writing to self-report a protocol deviation for subject 101-003, enrolled in Part A of the DNLI-123 study.

This morning, the participant missed their scheduled 4-hour post-dose PK blood draw. The participant had a family emergency and had to leave the site unexpectedly after the 2-hour draw was completed. All other procedures for the visit were completed as scheduled.

We have documented this event in the subject's source documents and are completing the Protocol Deviation form now. Please advise on any immediate actions required from our side and the next steps for reporting this to the sponsor.

Thank you,

Sarah Chen, CCRP
Study Coordinator
Oakwood Clinical Research Center

emails.subject: Fwd: [URGENT] Protocol Deviation - Study DNLI-123 - Site 456 - Subject 101-003
emails.body:
Hi Alex and Maria,

Please see the notification below from Site 456 regarding a missed PK sample for a Part A subject. This appears to be a significant deviation given the nature of the healthy volunteer cohort.

Sarah, thank you for the prompt notification. Please send over the completed PD form once it's finalized.

Alex/Maria - Please let us know your thoughts on the potential impact and how you would like us to proceed with documentation and follow-up.

Best regards,

Ben Carter
Clinical Research Associate
Synergy CRO

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Sarah Chen <sarah.chen@oakwoodcrc.com>
Date: Tue, May 21, 2024 at 2:30 PM
Subject: [URGENT] Protocol Deviation - Study DNLI-123 - Site 456 - Subject 101-003
To: Ben Carter <ben.carter@synergycro.com>
Cc: Emily Vance <emily.vance@oakwoodcrc.com>

Hi Ben,

I am writing to self-report a protocol deviation for subject 101-003, enrolled in Part A of the DNLI-123 study.

This morning, the participant missed their scheduled 4-hour post-dose PK blood draw. The participant had a family emergency and had to leave the site unexpectedly after the 2-hour draw was completed. All other procedures for the visit were completed as scheduled.

We have documented this event in the subject's source documents and are completing the Protocol Deviation form now. Please advise on any immediate actions required from our side and the next steps for reporting this to the sponsor.

Thank you,

Sarah Chen, CCRP
Study Coordinator
Oakwood Clinical Research Center

emails.subject: Re: Fwd: [URGENT] Protocol Deviation - Study DNLI-123 - Site 456 - Subject 101-003
emails.body:
All,

Thank you for flagging this. A missed PK sample in the HV cohort is indeed a significant deviation and will require careful assessment.

Alex, please take the lead on this. Can you please follow up with Sarah to ensure the deviation is documented thoroughly in the source and on the PD form? Once you receive the form, please review it and begin drafting an initial impact assessment for our internal clinical pharmacology team. We need to understand how this missing data point affects the overall analysis for this cohort.

Please let me know if you need any support.

Best,

Maria Garcia
Clinical Trial Manager
Denali Therapeutics

The site self-reported that a participant in the healthy volunteer cohort (Part A) missed their post-dose PK blood draw. The discussion focuses on documenting the deviation and determining the impact on data analysis.

emails.subject: Inquiry: DNL593 Study - Site 210 - Upcoming IP Shipment
emails.body:
Hi Alex,

Hope you are having a productive week.

The pharmacy team here at Oakwood Clinical Research (Site 210) would like to confirm the details for our next shipment of the investigational product, DNL593.

We are preparing for a couple of new participants who are scheduled for randomization soon and want to ensure our stock levels are adequate. Could you please provide an update on the quantity being shipped and the expected delivery date?

Thank you for your help.

Best regards,

Dr. Emily Carter, PharmD
Investigational Drug Services
Oakwood Clinical Research
